answers.answer: Not trying to be rude when i ask this question keep that in mind.. but were you over weight when you got pregnant? my cousin is over weight and she always measured wrong!! once again not trying to be rude!! i love everyone!!

I measured 4 weeks big with my son pretty much the whole pregnancy and when I went for the ultrasound, they found that I had polydramneos, excess amniotic fluid.  They did non-stress tests twice a week and an ultrasound every week for the rest of my pregnancy to monitor it.  I was 126 pounds when I got pregnant with him and only gained 25 pounds my whole pregnancy so I was not overweight AT ALL but had excess fluid.  Good luck.

I measured 3 weeks ahead all the time with my son...even from early on.I was only 120 and gained only 15 pounds...ending pregnancy weight of 135....but yet measured so large all the time.I failed me ges diabetes test and had to take the 3 hr and passed....but nothing really could contribute to the extra measurements....maybe that I had extra fluid...a lot of extra fluid.All in all my boy was fine....they did u/s every week from 34 weeks on because I was high risk....but they did estimate him to be 9lbs12oz and he was born 10 days early at 8lbs11oz....Good luck, I'm sure everything is fine.
Looks like we had the same diagnosis with our boys...polydramneosIt was kinda scary but everything ended fine for both of us....Good luck LandonsMomma

title: 28 Weeks But Measuring 33 Weeks
